Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Scoreboard
Direct Known Subclasses:
Dealer
public class Player extends Object implements Scoreboard, Cloneable, Serializable
A player object is the core of a blackjack game. Responsible for holding the playHand() method, these objects contain almost all of the information needed to run a run a hand.
Author:
gunnarvonbergen
See Also:

    Player(String name, int wins, int losses, int blackjacks)
    A player object hold important stats that track a player's data across multiple hands and games.

    This is a copy constructor that allows the option for cloning a player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int wins, int losses, int blackjacks)
      A player object hold important stats that track a player's data across multiple hands and games.
      Parameters:
      name - is the player's name.
      wins - is the number of wins the player has had.
      losses - is the number of losses the player has had.
      blackjacks - is the number of blackjacks the player has had.

    • Player

      public Player(Player other)
      This is a copy constructor that allows the option for cloning a player.
      Parameters:
      other - is the player object that is intended to be copied.

  • Method Details

    • displayStats

      public void displayStats()
      Displays important stats for the player. Including their name, wins, losses, W/L ratio, blackjacks, games played, and player rank.
      Specified by:
      displayStats in interface Scoreboard

    • setPlayerRank

      public void setPlayerRank()
      Player rank is set based on performance (win loss ratio) but only if the player has played sufficient games.
      Specified by:
      setPlayerRank in interface Scoreboard

    • playHand

      public void playHand(Deck deck, Dealer dealer)
      This void method is responsible for calling all methods relating to a hand playing out. The functions will loop until a player wins, loses, or draws against the dealer.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck object being played with containing the list of cards.
      dealer - the dealer being played against.

    • callDealer

      public void callDealer(Deck deck, Dealer dealer)
      Calls on the dealer to draw a card. This call on setFirstCardDealt() is used to make sure that the dealer doesn't tell the player the cards before the player does.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck object containing the array list of cards for the game.
      dealer - the dealer object being played against.

    • printHandQuery

      public void printHandQuery()
      Prompts the user to hit or stand and prints their existing hand value.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(Deck deck)
      Draws a card from the passed deck object. Adds the drawn card to the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck object containing the current game's cards.

    • checkStand

      public void checkStand(Dealer dealer)
      Handles calculations when standing, compares values of hands to the passed deal object.
      Parameters:
      dealer - the dealer containing the hand to compare to.

    • decideToHit

      public boolean decideToHit()
      Prompts the user to hit or stand and returns a boolean value representing their choice.
      Returns:
      a boolean value representing whether the player wants to hit or not.

    • calculateHandValue

      public int calculateHandValue()
      Calculates the player's current hand value. Calls to manipulate ace values if the player would've busted.
      Returns:
      the numerical value of a hand.

    • setValues

      public void setValues()
      Sets important values that need to be updated each loop.

    • getHand

      public ArrayList<Card> getHand()
      Provides access to the hand array list.
      Returns:
      the player's array list of cards.

    • getWinLoss

      public double getWinLoss()
      Returns the player's win loss ratio.
      Returns:
      the winLossRatio as a double.

    • getRank

      public String getRank()
      Returns the letter representation of the player's rank.
      Returns:
      a char representing the player's rank.
      See Also:
      • for a detailed player description.

      Returns:
      a new Player object that deep copies all attributes.

      public boolean getBusted()
      Retrieves the player's busted status.
      Returns:
      true if the player busted.
